document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Callipia Guenée, 1858 (Lepidoptera, Geometridae), with the description of 15 new taxa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Callipia Guenée, 1858 (Lepidoptera, Geometridae), with the description of 15 new taxa

bibRefCitation.author: Thierry-Mieg
bibRefCitation.refString: Thierry-Mieg P. 1904. Descripcions de Lepidopteres nouveaux. Le Naturaliste 26: 140.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Callipia languescens
Warren, 1904 : 539
(confirmed junior synonym of
rosetta
, see
Parsons et al. (1999)
( Figs 82 , 89 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
Callipia rosetta
is usually a rather small species. Some large specimens are provisionally included in C. rosetta (same BIN), but might turn out as different species if more data on the life history of the taxa become available. The spine-like process on the ventral margin of the valvae is well developed and larger than in
augustae
sp. nov. COI-barcode: the minimum observed distance to the genetically most similar (but not similar looking) species (
C.fulvida
) is 4.4%.

Originally described with two male as
syntypes
from Peru , [ Pasco ], Huancabamba , 1903 ( USNM ). One of these males is designated as
lectotype
(C-0290 with GS-286,
Figs 81
, 88 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eastern Cordillera of Ecuador and Peru ,
2100–3000 m
.
A living male is illustrated in Fig. 131 together with its habitat in Ecuador ( Fig. 132 ).
